translation: The glory of the alms-giver  Is praised aloud as popular
explanation: Whatsoever is spoken in the world will abide as praise upon that man who gives alms to the poor
mk: போற்றுவோர் போற்றுவனவெல்லாம் இல்லாதவர்க்கு ஒன்று வழங்குவோரின் புகழைக் குறித்தே அமையும்
mv: புகழ்ந்து சொல்கின்றவர் சொல்பவை எல்லாம் வறுமையால் இரப்பவர்க்கு ஒரு பொருள் கொடுத்து உதவுகின்றவரின் மேல் நிற்கின்ற புகழேயாகும்.
sp: சொல்வார் சொல்வன எல்லாம், இல்லை என்று வருபவர்க்குத் தருபவர்மேல் சொல்லப்படும் புகழே.
gptExplanation:
Kural 232 speaks about the virtue of charity, particularly towards those who are in need. It highlights the endearing social respect and praise that a charitable person earns in the society.

This verse implies that whatever is spoken in the world, all the praises and commendations, will eventually be attributed to the person who generously gives to the poor. The act of giving, especially to those who are lacking, is seen as a noble deed, earning the person a high degree of esteem and admiration in the society.

The phrase "abide as praise upon that man" emphasizes that such praise is not transient but remains with the person, enhancing their reputation and honor. This verse, therefore, encourages the act of giving, underscoring its value not only for the receiver but also for the giver in terms of the respect and admiration they gain.

In essence, this verse suggests that charity is a virtue that is highly valued and appreciated in society, and those who practice it are held in high esteem. It encourages individuals to be generous and kind, particularly to those in need, as it not only helps alleviate their suffering but also earns the giver enduring praise and respect in the society.
